channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16055] PutSortReducer loses any Visibility/acl attribute set on the Puts
item.description:
Based on a user discussion, I think as the user pointed out rightly, when a PutSortReducer is used any visibility attribute or external attribute set on the Put will be lost as we create KVs out of the cells in the puts whereas the ACL and visibility are all set as Attributes.
In TextSortReducer we tend to read the information we tend to read the information from the parsed line but here in PutSortReducer we don't do it. I think this problem should be in all the existing versions where we support Tags. Correct me if am wrong here.
Anoop Sam John, Andrew Purtell?
item.summary: PutSortReducer loses any Visibility/acl attribute set on the Puts

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: So the proposal is to make PutSortReduce tag attribute aware?
+1 for fix in all applicable versions.

Yes. But impl wise this is going to be tricky. Since there can be any attribute added to a Put we may not be able to use all of them. But atleast we could see if there is a visibility, acl and ttl attribute associated with the Put and if so try to create a cell out of those attributes by passing them as Tags.
Patch that supports adding TTL, ACL and visibility tags from the PutSortReducer.

+1 overall

The test report looks clean with the new test case added also passing. Good to commit in all the affected branches?
Ping for reviews - Anoop Sam John, Ted Yu.

78	      } catch (TableNotFoundException e) {		

79	        // Just return with out doing any thing. When the VC is not used we wont be having 'labels'		

80	        // table in the cluster.		

81	        return;

Why was the above catch taken out ?

Good question. The reason was that 


Since 0.98.1 this method no longer checks table existence. An exception will be thrown if the table does not exist only when the first operation is attempted.

Above comes in the javadoc of connection#getTable(). Infact when I tried with my test case I could see that instead of returning when Labels table was not found it was trying to do a scan and that is where TableNotFound was getting thrown. Then I saw this java doc and when I changed the catch things worked fine. May be we need to see the entire code and correct the src code or test code to ensure TableNotFound is caught at the right place.

Makes sense.

+1

cell.getValueOffset(), cell.getValueLength(), tags);

Chances are less, still if the cell is already having some tags with it, we should not be loosing them.
So here the user account, with which the Reducer gets run, should have SYSTEM visibility label. We have to document that as well?

So here the user account, with which the Reducer gets run, should have SYSTEM visibility label. We have to document that as well?

Yes. Infact interacting that User I wanted to raise the JIRA. Will raise one and have some things to discuss with respect to it.

Chances are less, still if the cell is already having some tags with it, we should not be loosing them.

Here we will not be having any tags. Because these cells are from Puts. currently we don't support Tags to be added with Puts. So should be fine I think.

Here we will not be having any tags. Because these cells are from Puts. currently we don't support Tags to be added with Puts. So should be fine I think.

Its not fully true. Because Put having an add(Cell) API and to that one can add any Tags. Even in normal put op path also, if one uses KVCodecWithTags Codec, we can get that even into system also. So better handle? Any way chances less.. U will have an extra check like getTagsLength()>0
Ok will handle it. I specifically did not handle as it is from Puts. If a Put.add(Cell) is used even then only for KeyValue we allow a constructor to add Tags but all those are internal. Fine anyway.
Updated patch. Handles existing tags if any.

+1 overall

I missed your latest comment. Will prepare a patch for 0.98.
Pushed to 0.98 @apurtell. Will check the status of the build and see if the added test case does not fail. In all other branches this test case is with @ignored tag.
